response: narrative=Iain Taylor was last seen at a parking lot near 10 East Cathcart Street, AB56 1PJ, his home address. He had been experiencing stress related to job loss concerns, which even at his young age in foster care, seemed to weigh on him due to the uncertainty it brought. Known to remain active on social media, his abrupt absence from all platforms was alarming to his friends, including his close friend Olivia and several colleagues like Denise Lucas, who noticed he hadn't been in contact. Iain's disappearance raised concerns rapidly, particularly given his lack of communication—a stark deviation from his usual behavior of staying in touch. Eventually, Iain was traced by family and found safe on Golden Knowes Road, Aberdeenshire.
narrative=Iain Taylor was last seen on March Road, Buckie. A colleague, Maurice Grant, reported Iain had illegal employment status and witnessed a crime.

narrative=Iain Taylor, a 14-year-old, was reported missing after leaving the sports club located near Gordon Crescent, AB34 5HJ, on foot. Witnesses later identified him in the parking lot adjacent to 37 North High Street, AB45 2PA, where he appeared to be in a distraught state. Known to have been struggling with mental health-related concerns, those close to him feared he might seek isolation. His foster family reported his absence when he failed to return home. After extensive efforts, local authorities located Iain at a motel on Beltie Road, AB31 4JT. Upon being traced, he exhibited signs of distress but was physically unharmed. Iain's safe recovery highlighted the importance of continued support for his wellbeing.
